text:
(1)
Coney Island Boardwalk (Reigelman), north side, between West 16th and West 19th Streets, showing Geo. C. Tilyou's Steeplechase Park, which was established in 1897. It has twice been destroyed by fire. The last one occurred on July 28, 1907.

December 1923.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
5

(2) The same, seen from the Coney Island Pier.

March 31, 1924.

Eugene W. Armbruster Collection.
A6 Neg # 3907
6

(3)
The same, a view more westward.

March 31, 1924.

Eugene W. Arbruster Collection
7

(4)
The same, seen after a snowfall.

April 2, 1924.

Eugene W. Armbruster Collection

A8 Neg # 3905
8
title: Islands - Coney Island - [Riegelmann boardwalk - Steeplechase Park.]

text:
(1) Coney Island (Reigelmann) Boardwalk, east from the Coney Island Pier, (foot of West 18th Street)
March 31, 1924
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(2) The same, showing at the left, the Oricle Baths, at the N.E. corner of West 16th Street.
March 31, 1924.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(3) The same, another view.
April 2, 1924.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(4) The same, to West 12th Street.
April 2, 1924.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
title: Islands - Coney Island - [Riegelmann boardwalk - Oriole Baths.]

text:
Coney Island (Reigelmann) Boardwalk, west of West 16th Street, showing Steeplechase Park (Boardwalk) entrance.  Silhouetted in the background is the Half-Moon Hotel.

June 1927.
Eugene L. Arnbruster Collection
title: Islands - Coney Island - [Riegelmann boardwalk - Steeplechase Park entrance.]

text:
(1) Coney Island (Reigelmann) Boardwalk, at the N.W. corner of West 16th Street, showing a portion of George C. Tilyou's Steeplechase Park. Shown on the right, is a view northward on West 16th Street, emphasizing the west side. The 3-story frame house, is at the N.E. corner of Surf Ave.

August 8, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, showing a more extensive view westward.

July 8, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Islands - Coney Island - [Riegelmann boardwalk - Steeplechase Park - West 16th Street in Brooklyn.]

text:
(1) Coney Island (Reigelmann) Boardwalk, at the N.W. corner of West 16th Street, showing a portion of George C. Tilyou's Steeplechase Park. Shown on the right, is a view northward on West 16th Street, emphasizing the west side. The 3-story frame house, is at the N.E. corner of Surf Ave.

(2) The same, showing a more extensive view westward.

title: Islands - Coney Island - [Riegelmann boardwalk - Steeplechase Park - West 16th Street in Brooklyn.]

text:
(1) Coney Island (Reigelmann) Boardwalk, north side, east from West 16th Street, showing the Oriole Baths and the "Coast" swimming pool.

August 8, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, the following year, and showing a change of names from View No. 1.

July 8, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Islands - Coney Island - [Riegelmann boardwalk - Lido Swimming Pool - Oriole Baths.]
